title: FinBloom: Knowledge Grounding Large Language Model with Real-time Financial Data
author: Ankur Sinha (Indian Institute of Management Ahmedabad), Chaitanya Agarwal (Indian Institute of Management Ahmedabad), Pekka Malo (Aalto University School of Business), ...
relevance_why: The techniques developed in this paper for real-time data integration and financial decision-making processes could inform methodologies for audio-visual data integration in music generation.
background: Handling financial queries by accessing real-time text and tabular data to improve decision-making in finance.
contribution: This paper introduces a Financial Agent to solve the challenge of equipping large language models with real-time financial context, achieving efficient answering of financial queries.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Conventional LLMs are limited as they rely on static datasets and lack real-time context integration.
technical_comparison.novelty: This work enhances LLM capabilities by integrating a Financial Agent that dynamically retrieves and contextualizes relevant real-time financial data.

key_innovation: Utilizes a dual-module system that includes a data retrieval mechanism alongside a financial context generator, enabling responsive and informed answers.
real_world_impact: This approach significantly enhances the utility of large language models in finance, improving decision-making and algorithmic trading processes. Companies could adopt these strategies to boost operational efficiency.
limitations: While the integration of real-time data is a strength, the system's dependency on both the quality of data sources and the adaptation into the existing LLM architecture poses challenges.

new_terms.knowledge grounding: **Knowledge grounding** refers to the process of equipping machine learning models with external data resources and contextual information to enhance their decision-making capabilities.
new_terms.real-time data retrieval: **Real-time data retrieval** involves accessing and processing the most current information continuously, allowing for dynamic responsiveness in applications like finance.
